Hello Michael

Thank you for your post.

This will be the point where the n=
ewbie illustrates the essence of
newbie-ness. I'm a mere information resear=
cher, not a Java or OS X expert
and so have major gaps in many areas.

I've=
 run into the java_home environment variable issue before and somehow
made =
things run that needed it. This time brute force and awkwardness isn't
work=
ing for me.

I'm running a g4 powerbook with 1gb ram, OS X 10.4.6 with both=
 Java 1.4.2
and 1.5 (5.0) installed. Earlier, I had not ticked the java pre=
ference to
Java J2SE 5.0. Now it is. (Haven't restarted thought, which I wi=
ll do now
that I've thought of it.)

I've downloaded the heritrix-1.8.0.tar=
.gz file and have placed it in the
robertmothershead/applications directory=
.

Not sure what to do after this and am concerned about bolloxing it up to=
 the
point where my limited knowledge prevents me from fixing it.

So far, =
I have performed a "set java_home=3D/usr" command in the terminal.
Then tri=
ed to launch the heritrix-1.8.0.jar file through both browser and
direct ex=
ecution. No luck. Similar results with earlier attempts.

Somehow think I'm=
 missing something simple and fundamental here. I'd
appreciate anything you=
 could do to point me on the right path.

Thank you again,
rm
